CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 16, 1957, page 1, reads: "No Sale to Negroes - The above three story dwelling at 4341 Schenley Farms Terrace was owned by the Extension Society of the Pittsburgh Evangelical Lutheran Church until sold last week to a white buyer for $18,000. The church turned down an offer of $21,000 made by W. Beverly Carter Jr., Courier publisher, because he is a Negro, Mr. Carter believes. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Two story brick house at 4341 Schenley Farms Terrace, enclosed front porch with double doors and several sun windows, small front lawn with stairs and walkway, child playing in driveway on left with hedges
